intro: Hetaeria samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan hetaeria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Savai'i in Samoa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas within the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with a distinct aroma reminiscent of other members of its family. Hetaeria samoensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
